content.description: Looking for some overhung fun?  Here's a longer and fun route with solid hand holds and heel hooks for days.  The vertical face of the boulder is OFF for feet in the roof section of this route, however, a softer rating climb can be made out of this if you use the vertical face.
content.location: Start on ya bum on the lowest point of the sloped roof.  Be careful though!  Some of these low rocks like to break...

content.description: This is one of those problems where the crux is the start.  A few burlier moves up to jugs to top out!
content.location: The stars on the pictures indicate the left ad right hand holds of the start; a nice juggy prow for the left hand and small rail for the right.  There are a few jibs sparsely placed on the under side of the rock or feel free to start with a right heel hook.

content.description: This is the most remote boulder in the front section of Beartown but it's still not that far from the path or other sections.  One just might not see it right away...   The David Schwimmer Boulder offers 2 semi-overhung routes; one of them being one of the longest in the front section.
